What is the optimal selling price of an item based on its historical price/volume data?

I'm trying to figure out how to price items on a market that appears to move randomly but within certain bounds. For example, here is a brief look at the time series data: DateTime Price Volume 2013-08-27 00:00:00 1.9299999476 4 2013-08-27 01:00:00 1.6849999428 2 2013-08-27 02:00:00 1.7024297714 2 2013-08-27 03:00:00 1.2264721394 2 2013-08-27 04:00:00 1.75 7 2013-08-27 05:00:00 1.5 2 2013-08-27 06:00:00 1.9299999476 3 2013-08-27 07:00:00 1.75 5 2013-08-27 08:00:00 1.7000000477 5 2013-08-27 09:00:00 1.8600000143 4 2013-08-27 10:00:00 1.8236290216 2 2013-08-27 11:00:00 1.8600000143 7 2013-08-27 12:00:00 1.8046891689 6 2013-08-27 13:00:00 1.9107458592 2 2013-08-27 14:00:00 1.9414916039 6 2013-08-27 15:00:00 1.9605424404 6 2013-08-27 16:00:00 1.8037977219 6 2013-08-27 17:00:00 1.871355176 4 2013-08-27 18:00:00 1.727257967 5 2013-08-27 19:00:00 1.6200000048 5 2013-08-27 20:00:00 1.8400000334 9 2013-08-27 21:00:00 1.8099999428 1 2013-08-27 22:00:00 1.8099999428 10 2013-08-27 23:00:00 1.7849999666 2 2013-08-28 00:00:00 1.8500000238 2 2013-08-28 01:00:00 1.8799999952 11 2013-08-28 03:00:00 1.9900000095 7 2013-08-28 04:00:00 1.8511325121 3 2013-08-28 05:00:00 1.8049999476 6 2013-08-28 06:00:00 1.8419520855 4 2013-08-28 08:00:00 1.7999999523 1 2013-08-28 09:00:00 1.9550000429 8 2013-08-28 10:00:00 1.9500000477 5 2013-08-28 11:00:00 1.9510477781 4 2013-08-28 12:00:00 1.9403985739 2 2013-08-28 13:00:00 1.75 3 2013-08-28 14:00:00 1.8400759697 6 So lets say I purchase one of these items at 1.50. The question is: at what selling price will I be able to maximize profit? Also, how can I account for any cyclical price movement? (as a side note, I am somewhat familiar with R and Rapidminer)
